title: Garrison Stadium, Gillingham
text:
Garrison Stadium is a running track and sports field in <a href="Gillingham%2C%20Kent">Gillingham, Kent</a>. The stadium has also been known as the United Services Sports Club, was built on land owned by the <a href="Ministry%20of%20Defence%20%28United%20Kingdom%29">Ministry of Defence</a> and was associated with the military establishments in the area such as <a href="Chatham%20Dockyard">Chatham Dockyard</a> and <a href="Royal%20School%20of%20Military%20Engineering">Royal School of Military Engineering</a>. The stadium is built on the area known as the <a href="Great%20Lines%20Heritage%20Park">Chatham Lines</a>, an area of open space extending between Gillingham and <a href="Chatham%2C%20Kent">Chatham</a>.
A cinder running track runs around the stadium. This was used in the 1960s for <a href="Athletics%20%28sport%29">athletics</a> meetings and Kent county schools championships and from 1968 by the City of <a href="Rochester%2C%20Kent">Rochester</a> Athletics Club. The central area of the stadium was used for <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> by the <a href="Medway%20Dragons">Medway Dragons</a>. The club now uses the playings fields attached to the stadium which are also used for <a href="association%20football">association football</a> and <a href="field%20hockey">field hockey</a> and were used in the past for <a href="cricket">cricket</a>.
<a href="Kent%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Kent County Cricket Club</a> used <a href="Garrison%20Ground%202">Garrison Ground 2</a>, which was situated to the east of the stadium, for <a href="first-class%20cricket">first-class</a> and <a href="limited%20overs%20cricket">limited overs cricket</a> matches between 1937 and 1972. The club has also used other pitches on the Chatham Lines, including <a href="Garrison%201%20Cricket%20Ground">Garrison 1 Cricket Ground</a> and <a href="New%20Brompton%20Cricket%20Ground">New Brompton Cricket Ground</a>.
